    • Method Detail

      • showResult

        public void showResult(MyGeneric<java.lang.Integer> myListInt,
                       double timeNaive,
                       MyGeneric<java.lang.Boolean> myListBoolean,
                       double timeErasthotenes)
        This method uses for inform the user about calculation results.
        Parameters:
        myListInt - This Integer list should keep the prime numbers which calculated with Naive Method.(Created with MyGeneric Class)
        timeNaive - This double variable should keep execution time for Naive Method.
        myListBoolean - This is Boolean list should keep the boolean results for Erasthotenes Method.(Created with MyGeneric Class)
        timeErasthotenes - This double variable should keep execution time for Erasthotenes Method.

      • displayNumberNaive

        public void displayNumberNaive(MyGeneric<java.lang.Integer> myList)
        This method uses for displaying naive method results
        Parameters:
        myList - This Integer list should keep the prime numbers which calculated with Naive Method.(Created With MyGeneric Class)

      • displayNumerErasthotenes

        public void displayNumerErasthotenes(MyGeneric<java.lang.Boolean> myList)
        This method uses for displaying Erasthotenes method results
        Parameters:
        myList - This boolean list should keep the boolean results for Erasthotenes Method.(Created with MyGeneric Class)

      • displayTime

        public void displayTime(double time)
        This method uses for displaying execution times of Naive and Erasthotenes type calculations.
        Parameters:
        time - variable for execution time

      • takeNumber

        public int takeNumber()
               throws MySmallerThanException
        This method uses for taking numbers from user. It controls the number and if number is smaller than 2, it informs user.
        Returns:
        the number of boundary value.
        Throws:
        MySmallerThanException - when the number is smaller than 2,
        java.util.InputMismatchException - when the user enter the character instead of number.

      • checkNumber

        public void checkNumber(int x)
                 throws MySmallerThanException
        This method checks the boundary number. If it is smaller than two, method throws an exception
        Parameters:
        x - Boundary number
        Throws:
        MySmallerThanException - If number is smaller than two, exception informs user.

      • warnUser

        public boolean warnUser(java.lang.String message)
        This method informs user about exception message.
        Parameters:
        message - string message of exception
        Returns:
        always return true because it represents 'an error occur'.
